text: So we showed how to convert DFAs to regular expressions.
And the summary is that DFAs, NFAs, GNFAs even, and regular expressions are all equivalent in the class of languages they can describe.
The second thing we did was a method for proving languages not regular by using the pumping lemma or closure properties.
And lastly, we introduced context-free grammars.
And we're going to see more about those on Thursday.
So with that, I think we're out of time.
And I'll thank you for the notes of appreciation.
And I think we're going to end here and see you on Thursday, if not before.
